metadata.Title: CVE-2016-10147 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - low.
metadata.Description:
crypto/mcryptd.c in the Linux kernel before 4.8.15 allows local users to cause a denial of service (NULL pointer dereference and system crash) by using an AF_ALG socket with an incompatible algorithm, as demonstrated by mcryptd(md5). Mikulas Patocka discovered that the asynchronous multibuffer cryptographic daemon (mcryptd) in the Linux kernel did not properly handle being invoked with incompatible algorithms. A local attacker could use this to cause a denial of service (system crash).

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-10147` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-1002-aws - 4.4.0-1002.2
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1023-azure - 4.15.0-1023.24~14.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-62-generic - 4.4.0-62.83~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-62-generic-lpae - 4.4.0-62.83~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-62-lowlatency - 4.4.0-62.83~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-62-powerpc-e500mc - 4.4.0-62.83~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-62-powerpc-smp - 4.4.0-62.83~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-62-powerpc64-emb - 4.4.0-62.83~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-62-powerpc64-smp - 4.4.0-62.83~14.04.1
linux-image-extra-4.4.0-62-generic - 4.4.0-62.83~14.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1023-azure - 4.15.0-1023.24~14.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-62-generic - 4.4.0-62.83~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-62-generic-lpae - 4.4.0-62.83~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-62-lowlatency - 4.4.0-62.83~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-62-powerpc-e500mc - 4.4.0-62.83~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-62-powerpc-smp - 4.4.0-62.83~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-62-powerpc64-emb - 4.4.0-62.83~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-62-powerpc64-smp - 4.4.0-62.83~14.04.1
linux-image-extra-4.4.0-62-generic - 4.4.0-62.83~14.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

notes.Note: jdstrand> android kernels (flo, goldfish, grouper, maguro, mako and manta) are not supported on the Ubuntu Touch 14.10 and earlier preview kernels linux-lts-saucy no longer receives official support linux-lts-quantal no longer receives official support

criterions.comment: linux-aws package in trusty, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1002.2').
linux-azure package in trusty, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1023.24~14.04.1').
linux-flo: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue.
linux-goldfish: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue.
linux-grouper: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue.
linux-lts-utopic: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-lts-vivid: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of life, was needed').
linux-lts-wily: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-lts-xenial package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-62.83~14.04.1').
linux-maguro: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue.
linux-mako: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue.
linux-manta: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue.
linux-signed-azure package in trusty, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1023.24~14.04.1').
linux-signed-lts-xenial package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-62.83~14.04.1').
